page.title: 01Lesser Lammermuir's SE Crner
page.content: Rolling uplands, nearly all over 500 feet, lies east of the Leader valley and north of the Tweed valley, and includes the east side of the Allan valley. Nearly all productive, chiefly as rough pasture with sheep and some cattle, but with many fields of managed grassland or barley; many small woods, chiefly conifers with some Scots pines, planted often in strips as wind-breaks. Mostly worked from valley farms, but there are two substantial farms near the centre of the block. Apart from these and associated cottages, no inhabitants and no roads except the one to these two farms. Two lochans, one shown on the 50,000 OS map and the other on the 20,000. Good walking country, traversed by the Melrose-Lauder section othe the Southern Upland Way.
